summary: This is an email from a victim of Jeffrey Epstein to an investigator, sent in February 2022. The victim provides new information about a man she saw at Epstein's house the night she was raped, identifies Jean-Luc Brunel from a photo, and requests contact with other victims for support. She also offers to help identify herself in evidence photos.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and convicted sex offender whose house the victim was at when she was raped.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.context: Identified by the victim as a man she recognized from photos who was present at a restaurant/club the night she first met Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a news article photo showing her with Jean-Luc Brunel on Epstein's island.

persons.name: Hein
persons.context: The recipient of the email, likely an investigator or legal representative, with whom the victim has previously spoken about her experiences.

connections.description: Brunel was present at a social venue the night the victim first met Epstein, and was later photographed with Epstein's associate Ghislaine Maxwell on Epstein's island.
Maxwell is referenced in a news article photo with Brunel on Epstein's island, indicating her close association with Epstein's activities.
The email sender (M) describes being raped at Epstein's house and refers to the trauma she faced from her encounters with him.

events.title: NY Post article about Maxwell and Brunel
events.description: The New York Post published an article with photos showing Ghislaine Maxwell and Jean-Luc Brunel on Epstein's private island.

events.title: Victim's previous email to investigator
events.description: The victim (M) sent an email to the investigator (Hein) recalling details, including recognizing Jean-Luc Brunel from a photo.

events.title: Victim requests support contact
events.description: The victim emails Hein again, stating she is having a tough time and requests help getting in contact with another victim for support.

events.title: Victim provides new information about another man
events.description: The victim emails the investigator to reveal she now remembers the identity of another man present at Epstein's house the night she was raped, who requested she 'visit' with him.

keyFacts: The victim reveals she now remembers the identity of a man who was at Epstein's house the night she was raped and who requested she 'visit' with him, noting this man no longer holds the position he did in 2020.
The victim identifies Jean-Luc Brunel from a 2020 New York Post article photo as a man present at the restaurant/club where she first met Epstein.
The victim references going through civil court process against Epstein's estate and undergoing extensive therapy to recover memories of her trauma.
The victim offers to provide photos of herself (current and from her youth) to help investigators identify her in evidence photos, noting a distinctive tattoo.
The correspondence shows an ongoing dialogue between a victim and an investigator, with the victim becoming more willing to disclose details over time.
